title: Nevada baseball opens fall scrimmages
text: Share Updated: 10/21 6:17 pm RENO, Nev. (Mynews4.com & KRNV) -- The Nevada baseball team has 12 fall scrimmages remaining, including the annual Wolf vs. Pack World Series from Nov. 12-15, head coach T.J. Bruce announced. All scrimmages are held at Peccole Park and are open to the public free of charge. Nevada’s next intrasquad scrimmage is set for this Tuesday, Oct. 20 at 3:30 p.m. PT. The reigning Mountain West champions will host scrimmages on Tuesday, Thursday and Friday for the next two weeks. Nevada’s annual Wolf vs. Pack World Series, which concludes the team’s fall training period, is set for Nov. 12, 13 and 15 at Peccole Park. First pitch times are scheduled for 3:30 p.m. on Thursday and Friday and noon on Sunday. The Wolf Pack will also announce its 2016 spring schedule tomorrow. Fall Scrimmage Dates Tuesday, Oct. 20 - 3:30 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 22 - 3:30 p.m. Friday, Oct. 23 - 3:30 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 27 - 3:30 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 29 - 3:30 p.m. Friday, Oct. 30 - 12 p.m. Tuesday, Nov. 3 - 3:30 p.m. Thursday, Nov. 5 - 3:30 p.m. Saturday, Nov. 7 - 5 p.m. * Thursday, Nov. - 12 3:30 p.m. * Friday, Nov. 13 - 3:30 p.m. * Sunday, Nov. 15 - 12 p.m.* Wolf vs. Pack World Series ----
